quoteFirst: Even such mature students had to make solemn oath, in the Chancellor’s presence, to use the books properly: make no erasures or blots, or otherwise spoil the precious writing.[345] Under these regulations the library was open from
quoteTime: nine to eleven in the morning
quoteLast: , and from one to four in the afternoon, Sundays and mass days excepted. Strangers of eminence and the Chancellor could pay a visit at any time by daylight.

quoteFirst: Linnets to W. At Gull L.V., Sept. 28th,
quoteLast: , continuous flocks of Linnets, Starlings, Chaffinches, and Mountain Sparrows to W., many of each on deck. The main immigration of the Chaffinch was from the middle of September to end of October, the bulk of the immigrants crossing south of Yarmouth.

quoteFirst: At Fort Lyon, rest is now being enforced, and every patient gets two rest periods, i. e., from
quoteLast: and from 1 to 3 P.M. Liberty is allowed only once a week; and overnight, once a month. Those who would be discontented anywhere have left, and those who have stayed feel they have our sympathy and support and are doing well.
title: Conference of Officers in Charge of Government Hospitals Serving Veterans of the World War

quoteFirst: The instant at which this line is vertical over the pole is not the same on any two consecutive nights, since the stars advance each day 4 minutes on the sun. On the 21st of March the superior passage takes place at 5 minutes to 11 at night; on the following night four minutes earlier, or at
quoteLast: . In three months the culmination takes place 6 hours earlier, or at 5 minutes to 5. In six months, _i.e._ on Sept. 22, it culminates at 10.
title: Astronomical Myths: Based on Flammarions's "History of the Heavens"
author: Blake, J. F. (John Frederick), 1839-1906; Flammarion, Camille, 1842-1925
